question: Maternal moality rate is calculated:-
exp: Maternal moality rate: - 'Maternal death' is defined as 'Death of a woman anytime in pregnancy, during labour/delivery or within 42 days of delivery Maternal deaths expressed as per 100, 000 live bihs is MMR. Direct cause of MMR - Post-paum hemorrhage. Indirect cause of MMR - Anemia.
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: In a given population, total bihs in a year are 4050. There are 50 still bihs. 50 neonates die within first 7 days of life whereas the number of deaths within 8-28 days of life is 150. What is the Neonatal moality rate in the population?
exp: In the given question, Total neonatal deaths = Total early neonatal deaths + Total late neonatal deaths = 50 + 150 = 200 Total live bihs = Total bihs - Total stillbihs = 4050 - 50 = 4000 NMR= Neonatal death/Live bihs*1000 Thus, Neonatal moality rate, NMR = 200/4000 X 1000 = 50 per 1000 live bihs.
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: All are included in Kangaroo Mother Care except:
exp: KANGAROO MOTHER CARE is for prevention of neonatal hypothermia in low bih weight/premature newborns: Skin -to -skin positioning of newborn on mother's chest. Adequate nutrition through breast feeding. Early discharge and ambulatory care. Suppo to the mother and family for child care.
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: How many antenatal visits covering the entire period of pregnancy are minimum required?
exp: Minimum no. of Antenatal visits required in Pregnancy: 4 1st visit - within 12 weeks, preferably as soon as the pregnancy is suspected, for registration of pregnancy and first antenatal check-up. 2nd visit between 14 and 26 weeks POG. 3rd visit - between 28 and 34 weeks POG. 4th visit - between 36 weeks - Delivery Recommended Antenatal visits: 13-14 0-7 months = once a month = 7 visits 8th month = twice a month = 2 visits 9th month onwards = one visit/ week =4-5 visits Post natal visits: 3-4 3 in institutional delivery- Day 3, 7, 42 4 in home delivery- Day 1, 3, 7, 42
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: What is the best indicator to evaluate obstetric and neonatal care given at around the time of bih?
exp: Perinatal Moality Rate is a 'yardstick' of obstetric and pediatric care before and around the time of bih. PNMR includes time b/w 28weeks POG to 7days post-delivery. PNMR = x 1000. (formula as per WHO) MCC of perinatal deaths - Lowbih weight & prematurity.
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: A pregnant lady was found to be HIV positive in First trimester. Next line of management is:
exp: Current guidelines A should be staed at any CD4 count Any age Any clinical staging Any & all population New born of HIV +ve mother should be given nevirapine & cotrimoxazole, after delivery In HIV +ve pregnant female, sta A As soon as possible, throughout pregnancy & lifelong
opa: Sta A now, continue throughout pregnancy and till 6 weeks after delivery
opb: Sta A now, continue throughout pregnancy and till lifelong
opc: Sta A after First trimester, continue throughout pregnancy and till 6 weeks after delivery
opd: Sta A after First trimester, continue throughout pregnancy and till lifelong
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: Extra caloric requirement in pregnancy is:-
exp: Additional energy requirements:- Pregnancy +350 Kcal/day. Lactation (0-6months) + 600 Kcal/day. Lactation(6-12 mths) +520 kcal/day.
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: Essential obstetric care does not include:-
exp: Components of obstetric care in RCH program:- Essential Obstetric Newborn care Emergency Obstetric Newborn Care -Level 1 -PHC's Early registration of pregnancy (within 12-16 weeks) Antenatal care: Min 3 checkups by ANM/MO Safe Delivery Postnatal care- Min. 3 postnatal checkups New born Care Basic Em. ONC - Level 2 - 24 x 7 PHC's, CHC's Manual removal of Placenta Oxytocics Antibiotics Anti convulsants Assisted Delivery Vaccum aspiration New born Resuscitation Comprehensive Em. ONC - Level 3 - District Hospital, FRU's includes Basic Em. ONC and 8. Blood transfusion 9. surgery
opc: Safe delivery at home or institution
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: In a Village of 10, 000 population, there are 500 total bihs and 400 total live bihs in a year. In that year there were 24 Infant deaths and 8 maternal deaths. IMR will be:-
exp: MCC of IMR India - LBW & prematurity. IMR of India - 33. IMR is a rate. IMR is the best indicator of availability of health services, utilization of health services, effectiveness of health services in given community.
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: Perinatal moality denominator include:-
exp: Perinatal moality rate includes both late fetal deaths and early neonatal deaths PNMR = late fetal death and early neonatal deaths weighing over 1000 gms at bih /Total live bihs weighing over 1000 gm at bih x 1000 Perinatal period is from 28 weeks period of gestation to 7th completed days of life. The WHO's definition, more appropriate in nations with well established vital records of stillbihs is as follows: PMR = Late foetal deaths (28 weeks gestation and more)+ early neonatal deaths (first week) in one year - - ----- --- ----- x 1000 Live bihs + late foetal deaths(28 weeks gestation and more). The WHO's definition, more appropriate in nations with less well established vital records, is: Perinatal moality rate- Late foetal deaths + postnatal deaths/Live bihs in a year X 1000. There is a difference in denominator of the perinatal moality rate defined by the WHO and industrially developednations.
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: If bih rate of a sub-centre of population 5000 is 25/1000 then expected no. of pregnancies in a year will be:
exp: Expected no. of live bihs (Y)/year = Bih rate (per 1000 population) x population of the area /1000 As some pregnancies may not result in a live bih (i. e. aboions and stillbihs may occur), the expected number of live bihs would be an under-estimation of the total number of pregnancies. Hence, a correction factor of 10% is required, i. e. add 10% to the figure obtained above. So, the total number of expected pregnancies (Z) = Y + 10% of Y Given Bih rate is 25/1000 population Population under the sub-center 5000 Therefore, expected number of live bihs= {25 x 5000}/1000= 125 bihs Correction factor (pregnancy wastage) = 10% of 125 say 13 Therefore, total no. of expected 125 + 13 =138 pregnancies in a year
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: All of the following are the Intranatal causes of Perinatal moality except:-
exp: Causes of perinatal moality: Antenatal cause Intranatal cause Maternal disease -HTN, DM, TB, Anemia, Cardiovascular disease Bih injuries Pelvic disease Bih asphyxia Anatomical defects Prolonged effo time; obstructed labour Endocrine imbalance Other Obstetric complications Malnutrition Postnatal causes Toxemias Prematurity Antepaum hemorrhage Respiratory distress syndrome Congenital defects Respiratory and alimentary infections Advanced maternal age Congenital anomalies Blood incompatibilities
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: Iron and Folic acid is staed during which period of pregnancy?
exp: Adult iron folic acid (IFA) tablets requirement during pregnancy: One tablet per day (60 mg Iron + 500 mcg Folic acid) Staed during second trimester of pregnancy (4th month POG) Given for 180 days during Pregnancy and 180 days Post paum.
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: All of the following are considered as High-risk pregnancy except:
exp: RISK APPROACH High risk cases - Elderly primi (30 years and over). Sho statured primi (140 cm and below). Malpresentations ie. breech, transverse lie, etc. Antepaum haemorrhage, Threatened aboion. Pre-eclampsia and eclampsia. Anemia. Twins, hydramnios. Previous still-bih, intrauterine death, manual removal of placenta. Elderly grandmultiparas. Prolonged pregnancy (14 days-after expected date of delivery). History of previous caesarean or instrumental delivery. Pregnancy associated with general diseases, viz. cardiovascular disease, kidney disease, diabetes, tuberculosis, liver disease, malaria, convulsions, asthma, HIV, I, STI, etc. Treatment for infeility. Three or more spontaneous consecutive aboions.
opb: Sho statured primi (150 cm and below)
opc: History of previous caesarean or instrumental delivery
opd: Prolonged pregnancy (14 days after expected date of delivery)
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: In a town of 20, 000 population, total 456 bihs were there in a year out of which 56 were dead born. The total deaths were 247 out of which 56 deaths were within the first 28 days of life and another 34 had died after 28 days and before completing the first bihday. Calculate the Infant moality rate of this area.
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: Adult IFA tablets contain:-
exp: IFA TABLETS: Adult IFA tablets contain Iron 60mg + F. A. 500mcg (Red tablet) Pediatric syrup (6m-6y) contain Iron 20mg + F. A. 100 mcg (50 ml Bottle) given biweekly
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: Among the following the Best indicator of health in a community is:
exp: IMR is most impoant indicator of Health status of community Level of living and Effectiveness of MCH services in general The infant moality rate is 'The best predictors of State failure' IMR = Infant deaths/live bihs x 1000
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators

question: Vitamin K is given to every child at the age of:-
exp: Vitamin K: The role of Vitamin K is to stimulate the production and/or the release of ceain coagulation factors. In Vitamin K deficiency, prothrombin content of blood is markedly decreased & blood clotting time is considerably prolonged. Newborn infants tend to be deficient in vitamin K due to minimal stores of prothrombin at bih & lack of an established intestinal flora. Thus, soon after bih, all infants or those at increased risk should receive a single intramuscular dose of a Vitamin K preparation (0. 1- 0. 2 mg of menadione sodium bisulphite or 0. 5 mg of vitamin K1) by way of prophylaxis.
topic_name: Obstetric Care in RCH: Visits, IFA, TT, MCH Indicators
